brightbox-datasource-database-type.body:
data "brightbox_database_type" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) A regex string to apply to the Database Type list returned by Brightbox Cloud.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) A regex string to apply to the Database Type list returned by Brightbox Cloud.
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" is set to the ID of the found Database Type. In addition, the
following attributes are exported:
    # "disk_size" - The disk size of the database server for this type
    # "description" - (Optional) A regex string to apply to the Database Type list returned by Brightbox Cloud.
    # "ram" - The memory size of the database server for this type
    # "description" - (Optional) A regex string to apply to the Database Type list returned by Brightbox Cloud.
}
brightbox-datasource-database-type.description:
Use this data source to get the ID of a Brightbox Database Type for use in other
resources.

brightbox-datasource-image.body:
data "brightbox_image" "$1" {
    # most_recent - (Optional) If more than one result is returned, use the most recent image based upon the `created_at` time.
    most_recent = ""

    # name - (Optional) A regex string to apply to the Image list returned by Brightbox Cloud.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) A regex string to apply to the Image list returned by Brightbox Cloud.
    description = ""

    # source_type - (Optional) Either `upload` or `snapshot`.
    source_type = ""

    # owner - (Optional) The account id that owns the image. Matches exactly.
    owner = ""

    # arch - (Optional) The architecture of the image: either `x86_64` or `i686`.
    arch = ""

    # public - (Optional) Boolean to select a public image.
    public = ""

    # official - (Optional) Boolean to select an official image.
    official = ""

    # compatibility_mode - (Optional) Boolean to match the compatibility mode flag.
    compatibility_mode = ""

    # username - (Optional) The username used to logon to the image. Matches exactly.
    username = ""

    # ancestor_id - (Optional) The image id of the parent of the image you are looking for.
    ancestor_id = ""

    # licence_name - (Optional) The name of the licence for the image. Matches exactly.
    licence_name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" is set to the ID of the found Image. In addition, the following attributes
are exported:
    # "status" - The state the image is in. Usually "available", "deprecated"
    # "licence_name" - (Optional) The name of the licence for the image. Matches exactly.
    # "created_at" - The time and date the image was created/registered (UTC)
    # "licence_name" - (Optional) The name of the licence for the image. Matches exactly.
    # "locked" - true if image has been set as locked and can not be deleted
    # "licence_name" - (Optional) The name of the licence for the image. Matches exactly.
    # "virtual_size" - The virtual size of the disk image "container" in MB
    # "licence_name" - (Optional) The name of the licence for the image. Matches exactly.
    # "disk_size" - The actual size of the data within the Image in MB
    # "licence_name" - (Optional) The name of the licence for the image. Matches exactly.
}
brightbox-datasource-image.description:
Use this data source to get the ID of a Brightbox Image for use in other
resources.

brightbox-datasource-server-group.body:
data "brightbox_server_group" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) A regex string to apply to the Server Group list returned by Brightbox Cloud.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) A regex string to apply to the Server Group list returned by Brightbox Cloud.
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the Server
    # "description" - (Optional) A regex string to apply to the Server Group list returned by Brightbox Cloud.
}
brightbox-datasource-server-group.description:
Use this data source to get the ID of a Brightbox Server Group for use in other
resources.

brightbox-resource-cloudip.body:
resource "brightbox_cloudip" "$1" {
    # target - (Required) The CloudIP mapping target. This is the interface from a server, or the id of a load balancer or cloud sql resource
    target = ""

    # name - (Optional) a label to assign to the CloudIP
    name = ""

    # reverse_dns - (Optional) The reverse DNS entry for the CloudIP
    reverse_dns = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the CloudIP
    # "fqdn" - Fully Qualified Domain Name of the CloudIP
    # "public_ip" - the public IPV4 address of the CloudIP
    # "status" - Current state of the CloudIP: "mapped" or "unmapped"
    # "username" - The username used to log onto the server
}

brightbox-resource-container.body:
resource "brightbox_container" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) A label assigned to the Container
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) A further description of the Container
    description = ""

    # orbit_url - (Optional) The Orbit URL you wish to talk to. This defaults to either `https://orbit.brightbox.com/v1/` or the contents of the `BRIGHTBOX_ORBIT_URL` environment variable if set.
    orbit_url = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "auth_user" - the api client id used to access the container
    # "auth_key" - the client secret used to access the container
    # "account_id" - the account under which the container is stored
}
brightbox-resource-container.description:
Provides a Brightbox Container resource. This can be used to create,
modify, and delete Containers in Orbit.

brightbox-resource-database-server.body:
resource "brightbox_database_server" "$1" {
    # allow_access - (Required) - A list of server group ids, server ids or IPv4 address references the database server should be accessible from. There must be at least one entry in the list
    allow_access = ""

    # name - (Optional) A label assigned to the Database Server
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) A further description of the Database Server
    description = ""

    # maintenance_weekday - (Optional) Numerical index of weekday (0 is Sunday, 1 is Monday...) to set when automatic updates may be performed. Default is 0 (Sunday). 
    maintenance_weekday = ""

    # maintenance_hour - (Optional) Number representing 24hr time start of maintenance window hour for x:00-x:59 (0-23). Default is 6
    maintenance_hour = ""

    # database_engine - (Optional) Database engine to request. Default is mysql.
    database_engine = ""

    # database_version - (Optional) Database version to request. Default is 5.5.
    database_version = ""

    # database_type - (Optional) ID of the Database Type required.
    database_type = ""

    # snapshot - (Optional) - Database snapshot id to build from
    snapshot = ""

    # zone - (Optional) The handle of the zone required (`gb1-a`, `gb1-b`)
    zone = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the Database Server
    # "admin_username" - The username used to log onto the database
    # "admin_password" - The password used to log onto the database
    # "status" - Current state of the database server, usually "active" or "deleted"
    # "locked" - True if database server has been set to locked and cannot be deleted
}
brightbox-resource-database-server.description:
Provides a Brightbox Database Server resource. This can be used to create,
modify, and delete Database Servers.

brightbox-resource-firewall-policy.body:
resource "brightbox_firewall_policy" "$1" {
    # server_group - (Optional) The ID of the Server Group the policy will be applied to
    server_group = ""

    # name - (Optional) A label to assign to the Firewall Policy
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) A further description of the Firewall Policy
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the Firewall Policy
}
brightbox-resource-firewall-policy.description: Provides a Brightbox Firewall Policy resource.

brightbox-resource-firewall-rule.body:
resource "brightbox_firewall_rule" "$1" {
    # firewall_policy - (Required) The ID of the firewall policy this rule belongs to
    firewall_policy = ""

    # protocol - (Optional) Protocol Number or one of `tcp`, `udp`, `icmp`
    protocol = ""

    # source - (Optional) Subnet, ServerGroup or ServerID. `any`,`10.1.1.23/32` or `srv-4ktk4`
    source = ""

    # source_port - (Optional) single port, multiple ports or range separated by `-` or `:`; upto 255 characters. Example - `80`, `80,443,21` or `3000-3999`
    source_port = ""

    # destination - (Optional) Subnet, ServerGroup or ServerID. `any`,`10.1.1.23/32` or `srv-4ktk4`
    destination = ""

    # destination_port - (Optional) single port, multiple ports or range separated by `-` or `:`; upto 255 characters. Example - `80`, `80,443,21` or `3000-3999`
    destination_port = ""

    # icmp_type_name - (Optional) ICMP type name. `echo-request`, `echo-reply`. Only allowed if protocol is `icmp`.
    icmp_type_name = ""

    # description - (Optional) A further description of the Firewall Rule
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the Firewall Rule
}
brightbox-resource-firewall-rule.description: Provides a Brightbox Firewall Rule resource.

brightbox-resource-load-balancer.body:
resource "brightbox_load_balancer" "$1" {
    # port - (Required) Port to connect to to check health
    port = ""

    # type - (Required) Type of health check required: `tcp` or `http`
    type = ""

    # out - (Required) Port to pass through to
    out = ""

    # in - (Required) Port to listen on
    in = ""

    # protocol - (Required) Protocol of the listener. One of `tcp`, `http`, `https`, `http+ws`, `https+wss`
    protocol = ""

    # healthcheck - (Required) A healthcheck block. The Healthcheck block is described below
    healthcheck = ""

    # listener - (Required) An array of listener blocks. The Listener block is described below
    listener = ""

    # name - (Optional) A label assigned to the Load Balancer
    name = ""

    # policy - (Optional) Method of load balancing to use, either `least-connections` or `round-robin`
    policy = ""

    # certificate_pem - (Optional) A X509 SSL certificate in PEM format. Must be included along with `certificate_key`. If intermediate certificates are required they should be concatenated after the main certificate
    certificate_pem = ""

    # certificate_private_key - (Optional) The RSA private key used to sign the certificate in PEM format. Must be included along with `certificate_pem`
    certificate_private_key = ""

    # buffer_size - (Optional) Buffer size in bytes
    buffer_size = ""

    # nodes - (Optional) An array of Server IDs
    nodes = ""

    # timeout - (Optional) Timeout of connection in milliseconds. Default is 50000
    timeout = ""

    # request - (Optional) Path used for HTTP check
    request = ""

    # interval - (Optional) Frequency of checks in milliseconds
    interval = ""

    # timeout - (Optional) Timeout of health check in milliseconds
    timeout = ""

    # threshold_up - (Optional) Number of checks that must pass before connection is considered healthy
    threshold_up = ""

    # threshold_down - (Optional) Number of checks that must fail before connection is considered unhealthy
    threshold_down = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the Load Balancer
    # "status" - Current state of the load balancer. Usually "creating" or "active"
    # "locked" - True if the database server has been set to locked and cannot be deleted
}
brightbox-resource-load-balancer.description:
Provides a Brightbox Load Balancer resource. This can be used to create,
modify, and delete Load Balancers.

brightbox-resource-server.body:
resource "brightbox_server" "$1" {
    # server_groups - (Required) - An array of server group ids the server
    server_groups = ""

    # image - (Required) The Server image ID
    image = ""

    # name - (Optional) The Server name
    name = ""

    # type - (Optional) The handle of the server type required (`1gb.ssd`, etc)
    type = ""

    # zone - (Optional) The handle of the zone required (`gb1-a`, `gb1-b`)
    zone = ""

    # user_data - (Optional) - A string of the desired User Data for the Server.
    user_data = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the Server
    # "fqdn" - Fully Qualified Domain Name of server
    # "hostname" - short name of server, usually the same as the "id"
    # "interface" - the id reference of the network interface. Used to target cloudips.
    # "ipv4_address_private" - The RFC 1912 address of the server
    # "ipv6_address" - the IPv6 address of the server
    # "ipv6_hostname" - the FQDN of the IPv6 address
    # "public_hostname" - the FQDN of the public IPv4 address. Appears if a cloud ip is mapped
    # "ipv4_address" - the public IPV4 address of the server. Appears if a cloud ip is mapped
    # "locked" - True if server has been set to locked and cannot be deleted
    # "status" - Current state of the server, usually "active", "inactive"
    # "username" - The username used to log onto the server
}
brightbox-resource-server.description:
Provides a Brightbox Server resource. This can be used to create,
modify, and delete Servers. Servers also support
[provisioning](/docs/provisioners/index.html).

brightbox-resource-server-group.body:
resource "brightbox_server_group" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) A label assigned to the Server Group
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) A further description of the Server Group
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the Server
}
brightbox-resource-server-group.description:
Provides a Brightbox Server Group resource. This can be used to create,
modify, and delete Server Groups.
